shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables local audio capture.
Enables or disables the local audio capture function.

section.p:
This method disables or re-enables the local audio function, thereby stopping or restarting local audio capture. The difference between this method and is as follows:
: Disables or re-enables local audio capture and processing. If you disable or re-enable local audio capture using this method, the local user may hear an interruption in remote audio playback.
: Only stops or resumes sending the local audio stream without affecting the audio capture state. This method does not affect receiving remote audio streams. Setting enabled to is suitable for scenarios where you only want to receive remote audio streams without sending local audio.You can call this method before or after joining a channel. If called before joining, it only sets the device state and takes effect immediately after joining.

controls whether to enable local audio capture and processing. When this method is called to disable or re-enable local audio capture, the local user may hear interruptions in remote audio playback. The difference between this method and is:
: Controls whether to enable local audio capture and processing.
: Only controls whether to send the local audio stream, without affecting the audio capture state.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: enableLocalAudio(false) is suitable for scenarios where only remote audio streams are received without sending locally captured audio. This method does not affect receiving remote audio streams.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You can call this method before or after joining a channel. If called before joining, it only sets the device state and takes effect immediately after joining.
You can call this method before or after joining a channel. Calling it before joining only sets the device state and takes effect immediately after joining.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the callback, reporting LOCAL_AUDIO_STREAM_STATE_STOPPED (0) or LOCAL_AUDIO_STREAM_STATE_RECORDING (1).
Once the local audio function is disabled or re-enabled, the SDK triggers the callback to report LOCAL_AUDIO_STREAM_STATE_STOPPED (0) or LOCAL_AUDIO_STREAM_STATE_RECORDING (1).

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable local audio capture:
: (Default) Re-enables the local audio function, i.e., starts the local audio capture device (e.g., microphone).
: Disables the local audio function, i.e., stops local audio capture.
